content: supplies needed needles us 13/9mm 16 circular knitting needles us 13/9mm dpn s gimme all the cables toque double pointed needles stitch markers cable needle yarn needle scissors yarn suggested yarn super bulky 6 106 yards/skein i use lion brand wool ease thick and quick abbreviations p purl k knit kfb knit front back kfb is an increase stitch check the tutorial from verypink knits pm place marker k2tog knit two stitches together cf6 first three stitches onto cable needle place in front knit next three on main needle then knit three stitches on cable needle this pattern is the sole property of statement junkie this pattern is copyright protected and cannot be gauge copied or reproduced in any way this includes 3 stitches 4 row = 1 inch in stockinette making a few changes to this pattern and calling it your own the photos included in this pattern are copyright protected and are not to be used to sell pattern notes your items this pattern is written in standard this toque is worked in the round on 16 american terms circular needles if you are more comfortable using dpn s just make sure your resources stiches are distributed evenly on each if you have any questions regarding this pattern or needle require assistance reading the pattern you can contact me at either of the resources listed below youtube is also a great source for reading patterns or pattern sizing learning new stitches adult head circumference 23 my head is 23 and this hat fits perfectly not email statementjunkieknits@gmail com too tight and not too loose instagram @statement_junkie facebook https //www facebook com/statementjunkie/ finishing etsy https //www etsy com/ca/shop/statementjunkie | statement junkie | gimme all the cables toque - january 2019 ã| version 5 - january 24 | 1 this toque looks great with a faux fur pompom added or a large yarn pompom decrease toque pattern switch to us size 13/9mm dpn s i prefer to keep going with the circulars but if cast on 54 stitches and join in the round you are more comfortable with dpn s then place stich marker at the beginning on row go ahead make the switch to join in the round you can use your preferred method i use the method where row 22 you take one stitch from your left needle *p1 cf6* repeat 8 more times and place it onto your right needle then row 23 take the second stich on your right needle *p1 k6* repeat 8 more times and place it on your left needle always row 24 make sure when you are using circulars that *p1 k2tog k2tog k2tog* repeat 8 more your tail in on your right needle times you should have 36 stitches on your needles ribbing row 25 row 1-7 *p1 k3* repeat 8 more times p1 k2 p1 k2…continue around until you row 26 reach stich marker *k2tog* repeat * 8 more times row 8 increase row you should have 18 stitches on
